title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.17.4-5 | 15-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Gyanati Miran Dasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshuran Melitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvijesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gomra Bhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we are discussing from two verses, the fourth and fifth verses
of the 17 Chakras.
The first chapter of the first canto of Sriman Bhagavatam.
The fourth verse is as follows.
Paprachya Ratham Aarudhaha Kartasvara Paricchadam
Megha Gambhir Raya Vacha Samaropita Karmukaha
The meaning of this verse is, the fourth verse.
Maharaj Pariksit well equipped with arrows and bow and seated on a gold embossed chariot,
the fourth verse. The meaning of this verse is, the fourth verse. Maharaj Pariksit well equipped with arrows and bow and seated on a gold embossed chariot,
spoke to him, the shudra, with a deep voice sounding like thunder.
spoke to him, the shudra, with a deep voice sounding like thunder.
Pariksit Maharaj came to that spot, he noticed that Kali Purusha was actually beating an innocent carbon bull.
And he immediately, with a deep voice sounding like thunder,
he questioned this low class.
he questioned this low class.
unqualified person and Pariksit's words will be described
in the next two verses. So in the Parpochila, Prabhupada says
an administrative head or king like Maharaj Pariksit
with full majestic authority well equipped with weapons to chastise
miscreants can challenge the agents of the age of
Kali. Pariksit is a qualified Kshatriya. He has
got the courage to face
such upstarts. He is well equipped to deal sufficient punishment to the
miscreants and he has got his authority
to enforce law and order.
So he is competent to challenge the agents of the age of Kali.
So he is competent to challenge the agents of the age of Kali.
So he is competent to challenge the agents of the age of Kali.
So he is competent to challenge the agents of the age of Kali.
And as opposed to this
in the absence of such strong executive heads there is always disruption of
tranquility. Unfortunately we don't have qualified
Kshatriyas like Pariksit Maharaj in our present time.
If there is
no qualified Kshatriya then it is not possible to counteract the
influence, evil influence of this degraded
Kali Yuga. What is that evil influence of Kali Yuga? People
are exposed to too much sinful activities. The atmosphere is surcharged with
tendency to commit sins more and more and more and more without any restriction.
So this sinful age, the sinful age Kali Yuga. So the absence of strong executive heads
means people become more and more sinful. They are already sinful but they become more sinful without
caring for any adverse effect by their sinful activities.. they don't realise that.
The elected show bottle executive head. Show bottle means.. he appears like an
executive but he doesn't have qualification. He doesn't have strength, he doesn't have courage,
he doesn't have knowledge, he doesn't have training, he doesn't have skills.. he simply doesn't have
training, he doesn't have skill烫

how much he will have, etc, is beyond his level of application. Thus he is a not Ryan Pes politically nominated Kanna Akram started in May protests against the Indian Congress in 2016 before solidifying Akram on份 DNA.
training, he doesn't have skill, such a person is called show-bottling skater. He is a representative
of a degraded public because by votes a person becomes a ruler or a legislator or a governor
by votes. And who is voting this person. He gets but he is supposed to get majority votes
from people who are degraded themselves. They do not know what should be the qualification
of a proper Chhatriya who can rule properly they do not know. Neither the the representative
is actually qualified.
and Prabhupada says such show bottle executive heads cannot be equal to the strong king like
Maharaj Pariksit. You can never expect the situation now to be like what it was when
Pariksit was ruling or Yudhishthira Maharaj was ruling. The dress or style of royal order
does not count. It is one's actions which are counted. It is very important. The actions
are important. According to the proper understanding a person will perform different activities.
So those activities should be backed up by proper knowledge, by good culture. Then only
those actions will be good for the welfare of the entire human society.
The meaning of this verse is, O who are you? You appear to be strong and yet you dare kill
within my protection those who are helpless.
By your grace, you have saved my life. By your grace, you have saved my life. By your
grace, you have saved my life. By your grace, you have saved my life. By your grace, you
pose yourself to be a godly man, that means a king, Naradeva. But by your deeds, you are
opposing the principles of the twice-born Kshatriyas. So Pariksit Maharaj is questioning
this Kali Purusha, this Kali Purusha, this personality of this age of Kali. That who are
you? Because how dare you actually try to kill such helpless, innocent animals like
the cow and the bull. Even though you appear like a godly person, a Kshatriya is supposed
to be qualified and a god-conscious person. But you are not a godly person. You are a
Kshatriya. Your dress is externally appealing like a Kshatriya, but your actions are totally
opposed to those activities which are performed by a qualified Kshatriya. So in the Parpotsha
Prabhupada says, the Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas are called twice-born, vija.
Vija means they have two kinds of birth. For the two-born Kshatriyas, they are called
the two-born Kshatriyas. For the two-born Kshatriyas, they are called the two-born Kshatriyas.
For the two-born Kshatriyas, they are called the two-born Kshatriyas. For the two-born Kshatriyas,
they are called the two-born Kshatriyas. For the two-born Kshatriyas, they are called the
two-born Kshatriyas. For the two-born Kshatriyas, they are called the two-born Kshatriyas.
These classes of men, that is, Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaishya, there is one birth by parental
conjugation. Parents combine to conceive a child. That is the first birth. And there
is another birth of cultural rejuvenation by spiritual initiation from the bona fide
Acharya or spiritual master. So there is always second birth for those who are Brahmana,
Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Vedi culture. What is second birth?
Second birth is a cultural rejuvenation, reviving the spiritual culture. And how does it happen?
It happens by spiritual initiation obtained from the bona fide Acharya, by spiritual initiation.
So a Kshatriya is also twice born like a Brahmana. It is not only the Brahmanas who are having
this second birth. It is also the Kshatriyas and the Vaishyas. The Kshatriya's duty is
to give protection to the helpless humans. The Kshatriya king is considered to be representative
of God to give protection to the helpless and chastise the miscreants. It is called
Naradeva. Because, Deva because is the representative of God in human society. He is the representative
of God in human society.
He himself is a human being but he is meant to give protection to the human society by
following the rules and regulations of the authoritative scriptures to administer properly
to the human beings. Whereas in Kali Yuga there is no qualified Kshatriya. Whenever there are
anomalies in the routine work by administrators there is an incarnation of the Lord to re-establish
the principles of the Godly Kingdom. Krishna says in Bhagavad Gita,
I incarnate whenever there is neglect of religious principles and there is rise of irreligion.
I incarnate. And when Krishna incarnates, whenever, wherever he incarnates,
paritranaya sadhuna, he actually protects, saves the saintly persons, the law-abiding citizens
or those following strict religious principles.
And Vinashayaji Dushkrutami, he destroys these miscreants, these upstarts.
In the age of Kali, the poor helpless animals, especially the cows, which are meant to receive
all sorts of protection from the administrative age, are killed without restriction.
Nobody is there to voice the concern for the cows. They are helpless. They are innocent.
They are innocent.
And they are being killed without any restriction. There is no one to protect them,
no one to raise their voice against the cows being killed.
Thus the administrative heads under whose noses such things happen are representatives of God in names only.
The king is supposed to be a representative of God.
But such kings or administrators who are not God-conscious, who have not undergone spiritual initiation,
they are actually representatives of God in name only.
That means they are namesake administrators. They are not real administrators.
Such powerful administrators are rulers of the poor citizens by dress or office.
Simply they dress as if they are kings or administrators.
But they don't have the proper knowledge, the proper authority to actually properly
enforce the laws and the rules for ruling citizens.
Factually they are worthless lower class men without cultural assets of the twice born.
They don't have the culture to properly rule over the citizens.
No one can expect justice or equality of treatment from once born spiritually uncultured lower class men.
We can't expect when by votes some unqualified person comes and tries to carry out the administration.
We cannot expect any real benefit.
Therefore in the age of Kali everyone is unhappy due to the maladministration of the state.
People in general are very unhappy in Kali.
Therefore the people's government by the people who are not twice born must be a government of Kali in which everyone is unhappy.
You see, people should be unhappy if they don't have a proper leader, proper trained Kshatriya to rule them.
People must be unhappy.
And there will be no peace and prosperity in such a state.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
